content.text:
# Draft:Yumbah Aquaculture

----
Yumbah Aquaculture is an Australian owned seafood producer. Established from the consolidation of multiple onshore abalone farms, it has diversified into oysters, mussels, oyster spat production, and in 2025 introduced yellowtail kingfish (finfish). into its seafood portfolio. Headquartered in Adelaide, South Australia, Yumbah operates multiple integrated production sites across four states.
The company uses the name “Yumbah” thanks to the generosity of the Yaegl people who are the traditional custodians of the Yaygirr language, where the word means “larger shellfish”. Yumbah acknowledges and pays respect to the Yaegl people, as well as to the Traditional Owners of those lands and waters wherever we operate, including the Gadigal people of the Eora Nation, and the Barngala, Palawa, Bunurong, Kaurna, Worimi, Birpai, Darug and Gunditjmara people.
Operations and produce
Yumbah is a vertically integrated aquaculture company, with operations spanning feed production, spat production, farming, processing, and distribution across South Australia, Victoria, Tasmania, and New South Wales. Yumbah's farms and hatcheries operate in diverse locations across Australia and produce premium seafood for domestic and export markets.
Expansion through acquisitions
Since its formation, Yumbah has expanded via strategic acquisitions and partnerships, including:
* 2021: Acquired Cameron of Tasmania (oysters) and Bay Sea Farms (mussels)
* 2022: Took substantial interest in East 33, a Sydney Rock Oyster company.
* 2023: Acquired Eyre Peninsula Seafoods, becoming Australia’s largest producer of mussels.
* 2024 Acquired East 33, Sydney Rock Oyster company.
* 2025: Acquired Clean Seas Seafood Ltd, producer of Yellowtail Kingfish based in Port Lincoln.
Awards & Environmental Certifications
* 2025: ASC's Best Responsible Seafood Producer and Young Person in Aquaculture Award
* 2025: Best Aquaculture Practices (BAP) Certification for Yumbah's Tasmanian Oyster Farms
* 2024: SA Premier's Food and Beverage Awards - Mental Health and Wellbeing Award
* 2024: ASC's Best Responsible Seafood Producer Award
* 2024: Champion Aquaculture Product, Sydney Royal Fine Food Awards (Kinkawooka Mussels)
* 2024: Gold Medal, Sydney Royal Fine Food Awards (Kinkawooka Mussels)
* 2024: Gold Medals, Tasmania Royal Fine Food Awards (Kinkawooka Mussels, Boston Bay Mussels, Greenlip and Tiger Abalone)
